org.mmbase.module.lucene

Class MMBaseIndexDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mmbase.bridge.util.xml.query.QueryDefinition
      • org.mmbase.module.lucene.MMBaseIndexDefinition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexDefinition

    class MMBaseIndexDefinition
extends QueryDefinition
implements IndexDefinition
    An MMBase Lucene Index is configured by an MMBase Queries and 'subqueries' thereof. Also its fields can have extra attributes specific to Lucene searching.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Pierre van Rooden

      • MAX_NODES_IN_QUERY

        public static final int MAX_NODES_IN_QUERY
        The default maximum number of nodes that are returned by a call to the searchqueryhandler.

      • maxNodesInQuery

        protected int maxNodesInQuery
        The maximum number of nodes that are returned by a call to the searchqueryhandler.

      • subQueries

        protected final List<IndexDefinition> subQueries
        Subqueries for this index. The subqueries are lists whose starting element is the element node from the current index result.

        protected org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer analyzer

        public Node getNode(Cloud userCloud,
                    org.apache.lucene.document.Document doc)
        Description copied from interface: IndexDefinition
        Defines how a Node for this index must be produced. For MMBase indices this is of course quite straight-forward, but other indices may create virtual nodes here.
        Specified by:

      • getCursor

        public CloseableIterator<MMBaseEntry> getCursor()
        Description copied from interface: IndexDefinition
        Returns an Iterator over all IndexEntry's defined by this index. Only makes sense if this is not a 'sub definition'.
        Specified by:
        getCursor in interface IndexDefinition

      • getSubCursor

        public CloseableIterator<MMBaseEntry> getSubCursor(String identifier)
        Description copied from interface: IndexDefinition
        Returns an Iterator over all IndexEntry's defined by this index, restricted by a certain identifier. For a 'top' level index definition, this should normally return only one Entry, and the key must be the identifier of this entry. For 'nested' IndexDefinitions, the key most be the key of the parent.
        Specified by:
        getSubCursor in interface IndexDefinition

      • getNodeIterator

        protected NodeIterator getNodeIterator(String id)
        Creates an (Huge)NodeListIterator for this index definition
        Parameters:
        id - A node number. If used, the query will be limited. This is used to update the index on change of that node.
        Returns:
        the query result as a NodeIterator object

        public String toString()
